SVGAnimatedInteger.summary: The SVGAnimatedInteger interface is used for attributes of basic type <integer> which can be animated.

SVGAnimatedIntegerBaseVal.summary: The baseVal property of the interface represents the base (non-animated) value of an animatable <integer>.

remarks.para: Some attributes, like the {{SVGAttr("numOctaves")}} attribute of the feTurbulence element or the {{SVGAttr("order")}} attribute of the feConvolveMatrix accept a long integer as a value. This property provides access to the static non-animated state of the attribute as a number.

SVGAnimatedIntegerBaseVal.value: A long; the base (non-animated) value of the reflected attribute.

SVGAnimatedIntegerAnimVal.summary: The animVal property of the interface represents the animated value of an <integer>. If no animation is applied, animVal equals baseVal.

remarks.para: Some attributes, like the {{SVGAttr("numOctaves")}} attribute of the feTurbulence element or the {{SVGAttr("order")}} attribute of the feConvolveMatrix accept a long integer as a value. This property provides access to the current animated state of the attribute as a number.

SVGAnimatedIntegerAnimVal.value: A long; the animated value of the attribute.
